qas.question: How many days do you subtract to convert days from a calendar?
What does one need to remember about  the date of February 29 in the Julian calendar?
If you need a date of four days less, what do you subtract from the Julian calendar?
How many days you add to convert days from a calendar?
What is discounted when converting from Gregorian to Julian?
What you add to move from the Julian calendar to the Gregorian calendar?

context: Up to February 28 in the calendar you are converting from add one day less or <a0_0>subtract <b3_0>one day<b3_0/><a0_0/> more than the calculated value. Remember to give February the appropriate number of days for the calendar you are converting into. When you are subtracting <b5_0>days<b5_0/> to move from Julian to Gregorian be careful, when calculating the Gregorian equivalent of February 29 (Julian), to remember that <a1_0><b4_0>February 29<b4_0/> is discounted<a1_0/>. Thus if the calculated value is <a2_0>-4<a2_0/> the Gregorian equivalent of this date is February 24.
